creditline: Gift of funds from the Print and Drawing Council
portfolio: From From Cours complet d'anatomie, Nancy: Jean-Baptiste-Hyacinthe LeClerc, 1773
text: Death teaches the living. He offers himself up so that we may better understand who we are and how we function. Arnauld-Éloi Gautier-D'Agoty used up-to-date printing techniques to "colorize" anatomical studies that had been developed well over a century earlier.
title: Flayed Skeleton, from Cours complet d'anatomie, published Nancy, 1773
